Green Food Challenge
What is your carbon footprint? Do this quiz to find out how you can help fix climate change.
Reducing Consumption Select a plan that you prefer Changing diet to eat less high CO2 Food Reducing amount of food consumed Eating only plant-based protein (vegan)
Meat-Eater Plan Select a low CO2 protein that you prefer Pork (Pulled Pork, Roasted Pork,...) Chicken (Stir Fry, Fried, ...) Fish (Sushi, Fish and Chips,...) Egg (Quiche, Hardboiled, Fried,...) Beans (Falafel, Hummus, Tofu,...)
Low Meat Plan What is the amount of protein consumed you want to decrease per meal?
Food Quiz Dashboard Notifications 10 0 ResultsActivity
Carbon footprint is the impact of human activities measured in terms of the area of biologically productive land and water required to produce the goods consumed and to assimilate the carbon wastes generated. Carbon wastes, in other words, Greenhouse gases are measured in CO2e. They directly contribute to climate change.\n\n There are many different CO2e contributors, such as cars, and heating systems in buildings. But did you know, that food is also a source of CO2e? Our GreenFoodChallenge app measures how much CO2e your diet produces and helps discover how much you can save by making dietary adjustments! Find out what you can do to save Earth!
You consume Per year The average footprint for canadians is 8 metric tons The Average worldwide footprint is 4 metric tons The worldwide target to combat climate change is 2 metric tons Reduce Consumption
